result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

14CT42, 14CM174, 16CF56, 15CM75, 15CF76, 17CF14, 16CF60, status in all. Attorney Brian Walter Gleason appeared by phone means for Defendant Derek S. Nehls. Status conference on April 27, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 16CF60, 17CF14, 15CF76, 14CM174, 15CM75, 17CF11, 16CF56, 14CT42 all called together. Attorney Brian Walter Gleason in court for Defendant Derek S. Nehls. Defendant Derek S. Nehls appeared by video means from RCSD. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Motion was filed by Atty Gleason to reconsider bond for def. Comments by Atty Gleason. Atty Gleason makes request and asks bond to revert back to signature, once IA county cases are plead to. State argues. Court denies request to amend bond. Atty Gleason states he will discuss preliminary hearing matter with def re 17CF11.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for April 27, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on April 25, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on April 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 7, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

15CF76,16CF56,14CM174,17CF11,14CT42,17CF14,15CM75, AND 16CF60. Defendant Derek S. Nehls appeared by video means from RC Jail. Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Harper states this status was put on to establish legal counsel for def.  Def states his atty withdrew and is hiring new counsel.  His attorney is trying to contact Atty Matt Allen from Iowa County.  Def asks for one week to retain counsel.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on March 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Def from the jail

3:00 p.m.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant Derek S. Nehls. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek S. Nehls appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail for plea hearings in the following cases:  15CM75, 17CF11, 14CM174, 17CF14, 15CF76, 14CT42, 16CF56, and 16CF60.

Def informs the Court that he wants a different public defender.  Court allows def to relieve present counsel.  DA asks for 6th Amendment admonishment.  Court informs def of the ramifications of repeatedly firing counsel.  

Matters are all adjourned to 3/27 at 3:30.  SPD to appoint new counsel.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Def from the Richland County Jail
Plea hearing on March 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant Derek S. Nehls. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek S. Nehls appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody.  Several matters called together:  
17CF11/adjourned initial
14CM174/status

17CF14/preliminary hearing
DA Harper states that today was to be the prelim in 17CF14 but there will be a waiver.  Atty. Bartelt states Defense wants to be heard on bail; says parties are working towards resolution of all these matters.

17CF14 - waiver of prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re prelim waiver.

Court denies Defense' request for bail reduction.

Atty. B asks for plea hearing; will be asking for PSI.

Plea hearing set for 3/10 at 2.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

9:20 a.m.  This matter was calendared yesterday for status today at 9:15 a.m.  Atty. Bartelt did phone in at 9:15 a.m.  However, no hearing was held as the Defendant is still in the Sauk County Jail.  The Court/Clerk of Court have asked counsel (DA or Atty. Bartelt) to find out when the Defendant will be brought back to Richland County and advise the Court accordingly.  Once the Defendant is in the Richland County Jail, this matter will be rescheduled.
Status conference on February 2, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Several cases called together:  17CF11/initial, 14Cm174/status, 14CT42/status, 15CF76/status, 15CM75/status, 16CF56/status, 16CF60/status.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by phone means for Defendant Derek S. Nehls. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def is presently in the Sauk County Jail after arrest there; being brought back to Richland.  DA asks for adj. til tomorrow.  Court adj. to 2/2 at 9:15; Atty. B may phone in.  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on February 1, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's
4:15 p.m. email from Iowa County Jail:  Defendant was arrested and detailed this date in Iowa County; admitted to the jail there at 1 p.m.

1:57 p.m.  Several cases called together, all were calendared for 1:30 today.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant Derek S. Nehls. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek S. Nehls not in court.  DA requests warrant, noting that def recently had a non-appearance in Iowa County as well.  Court orders warrant.
Status conference on November 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:03 p.m.  Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court.  DA Harper appears for the State.  Several matters called together.  Def is without counsel at this hour, his attorney having appeared at 11 a.m. when this matter was set.  Def wasn't here at 11 - has stated that he thought his hearing was at 2 p.m.  DA - State has grown weary of def missing court appearances; asks for short reset, noting that one of these cases goes back to 2014.  Matters adjourned to 11/30 at 1:30.  Warrant vacated.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

11:33 a.m.  Several cases called together.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant Derek S. Nehls. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek S. Nehls not in court.  DA requests warrant.  So ordered.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.
RCSD dispo sheet - def in custody as of 8-15-16
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by phone means for Defendant Derek S. Nehls. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek S. Nehls appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail; states he was in a facility at the time the warrant was ordered August 3rd.  Atty. Bartelt states he's now counsel in this and other open Richland County cases.  Matter adj. to 9/14 at 10.

Court orders def reinstated to previous bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Several cases called together for status:  14CM174, 14CT42, 15CF76, 15CM75, 16CF56, and 16CF60. Defendant Derek S. Nehls not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Defendant Derek S. Nehls.  Matters were set for 9:05 a.m.  DA states that def recently failed to appear in Iowa County and a warrant has been authorized there for his arrest.  DA asks for warrants here in these Richland County matters.  So ordered.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Cases called together:  16CF60/initial (filed today), 16CF56/adjourned initial, and status in 14CM174, 14CT42, and 15CF76.

In 16CF60, DA asks for 5k signature bond.  So ordered.

16CF60 - initial appearance:  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to prelim. Defense waives formal reading as well as prelim time limits. 

Atty. Angel states that plea negotiations are underway; next hearing may be a plea hearing; asks that it be set as "status" in early July. Court sets 7/13 at 9.

Prelim time limits continue to be waived in 16CF56.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Submit to booking at the Richland County Sheriff's Department 5/4/16.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

14CM174/status, 15CM75/status, 16CF56/initial, 14CT42/status, and 15CF76/status called together.  Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  

16CF56 was just filed today.  DA requests 5k signature bond - def to submit to booking process at the jail before leaving the courthouse today.  Atty. A states def will waive 20-day rule for prelim in that matter.

Atty. A states DA has indicated a second bail jumping case is coming; asks for a date/time within the next couple of weeks for initial appearance on that.  DA states she's been waiting for paperwork from another jurisdiction before filing that matter.  Court sets 5/11 at 2:30 for initial in the new case.  

Other cases set for status that same date/time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
